messageBody:
> Isn't the problem that you're getting an Error and not
> an Exception?

Not quite. The way I understood this problem when it first got posted (some time ago now) is that the tested method itself starts a new Thread. This, and this alone (the multithreaded nature of the problem), is the basis for all the troubles.

Take a look at the ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(...) method for a solution. I.e. you would need to wrap the call within a ThreadGroup() which overrides this method so as to report errors or failures in the appropriate manner.

HTH,

Manuel Amago.
